name: methanol production, biomass gasification | methanol, from biomass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1506/documentation

The process describes the production of methanol derived from syngas and refers to a full-methanol steam reforming process to obtain a 2.2:1 H2:CO ratio of the syngas for the sole production of methanol. No CO2 use, no Hydrogen production (assumed to be burned in the furnace).;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Raw materials including syngas, processing energy, estimate on catalyst use based on 'methanol from natural gas', emissions to air and water from process, plant infrastructure.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data from 1995 to 2004, pilot scale, future technology
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from few literature sources, largely based on methanol from natural gas.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data refers to full-methanol steam reforming (as opposed to autothermal reforming) of syngas derived from biomass gasification.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Production assessed with mixed data from literature and the ecoinvent 'methanol from natural gas' process. Data is considered relatively weak, as there is no commercial experience of methanol from bio-syngas. Representativity of the data seems difficult to assess.
